name: Adlai Arrozcaldo
description: This Adlai Arrozcaldo is a healthified twist on the classic Filipino comfort food, perfect for anyone looking for a high-protein, low-sodium, and low-sugar meal. Packed with nourishing ingredients like boneless chicken thigh, Adlai rice (Job's Tears), and a medley of vegetables, this recipe offers a hearty and flavorful dish that supports a healthy lifestyle.

recipeInstructions.text: Begin by dicing the red onion and carrots, mincing the garlic, and thinly slicing the ginger.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Adlai Rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pot, combine the Adlai Rice with 6 cups of water, diced onion, minced garlic, and sliced ginger. Bring to a boil.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: While the rice mixture is coming to a boil, season the boneless chicken thigh with ground pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: Once boiling, reduce the heat to a simmer and add the seasoned chicken thigh to the pot. Allow to simmer for about 20 minutes, or until the chicken is fully cooked.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the chicken from the pot, let cool, then shred it into bite-sized pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6

recipeInstructions.text: Return the shredded chicken to the pot and add diced carrots. Cook for an additional 10 minutes, until the carrots are tender.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 7

recipeInstructions.text: Season the arrozcaldo with lemon juice and additional ground pepper to taste.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 8

recipeInstructions.text: Serve hot and enjoy your nutritious Adlai Arrozcaldo.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 9
